abstract: Decision by Christie's to hold its Impressionist and Modern Art evening auction in second week of May, rather than first, has reverberated through art world, with some welcoming decision and others complaining it is disruptive; Christie's says it made move in order to avoid clash with Venice Biennale.
lead_paragraph: This year, Christie’s has decided to hold its Impressionist and Modern art evening auction in the second week of May, not the first, as it usually does, setting off a chain of reactions.

headline.main: Shift of Christie’s Auction Crowds Art Collectors’ Calendars

snippet: This year, Christie’s has decided to hold its Impressionist and Modern art evening auction in the second week of May, not the first, as it usually does, setting off a chain of reactions.
